etymology.description: 女(女) (nǚ, "woman") + 子(子) (zǐ, "child") = a woman with a child -> mutual affection, extended meaning 'good'
etymology.interpretation: The character 好(hǎo) ("good") combines 女(nǚ) ("woman") and 子(zǐ) ("child"), depicting the traditional view that it is good for a woman to have a child, symbolizing affinity and care. This visual representation of nurturing and affection extended metaphorically to mean general goodness or well-being.

examples.chinese: 这本书写得很好(這本書寫得很好)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè běn shū xiě dé hěn hǎo.
examples.english: This book is written very well.

examples.chinese: 他今天心情很好(他今天心情很好)，所以笑得很灿烂(所以笑得很燦爛)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jīntiān xīnqíng hěn hǎo, suǒyǐ xiào dé hěn cànlàn.
examples.english: He is in a good mood today, so he smiles brightly.
